entries.desc: A specification of the result of a certification path builder algorithm.
entries.name: CertPathBuilderResult

entries.desc: A specification of certification path algorithm parameters.
entries.name: CertPathParameters

entries.desc: The reason the validation algorithm failed.
entries.name: CertPathValidatorException.Reason

entries.desc: A specification of the result of a certification path validator algorithm.
entries.name: CertPathValidatorResult

entries.desc: This interface represents an X.509 extension.
entries.name: Extension

entries.desc: An immutable valid policy tree node as defined by the PKIX certification path validation algorithm.
entries.name: PolicyNode

entries.desc: Interface for an X.509 extension.
entries.name: X509Extension

entries.desc: Abstract class for managing a variety of identity certificates.
entries.name: Certificate

entries.desc: Alternate Certificate class for serialization.
entries.name: Certificate.CertificateRep

entries.desc: An immutable sequence of certificates (a certification path).
entries.name: CertPath

entries.desc: A class for building certification paths (also known as certificate chains).
entries.name: CertPathBuilder

entries.desc: A class for validating certification paths (also known as certificate chains).
entries.name: CertPathValidator

entries.desc: This class is an abstraction of certificate revocation lists (CRLs) that have different formats but important common uses.
entries.name: CRL

entries.desc: This class represents the successful result of the PKIX certification path builder algorithm.
entries.name: PKIXCertPathBuilderResult

entries.desc: This class represents the successful result of the PKIX certification path validation algorithm.
entries.name: PKIXCertPathValidatorResult

entries.desc: An immutable policy qualifier represented by the ASN.1 PolicyQualifierInfo structure.
entries.name: PolicyQualifierInfo

entries.desc: A trust anchor or most-trusted Certification Authority (CA).
entries.name: TrustAnchor

entries.desc: Abstract class for X.509 certificates.
entries.name: X509Certificate

entries.desc: Abstract class for an X.509 Certificate Revocation List (CRL).
entries.name: X509CRL

entries.desc: Abstract class for a revoked certificate in a CRL (Certificate Revocation List).
entries.name: X509CRLEntry

entries.desc: The BasicReason enumerates the potential reasons that a certification path of any type may be invalid.
entries.name: CertPathValidatorException.BasicReason

entries.desc: Various revocation options that can be specified for the revocation checking mechanism.
entries.name: PKIXRevocationChecker.Option

entries.desc: Certificate Encoding Exception.
entries.name: CertificateEncodingException

entries.desc: This exception indicates one of a variety of certificate problems.
entries.name: CertificateException

entries.desc: Certificate Expired Exception.
entries.name: CertificateExpiredException

entries.desc: Certificate is not yet valid exception.
entries.name: CertificateNotYetValidException

entries.desc: Certificate Parsing Exception.
entries.name: CertificateParsingException

entries.desc: An exception that indicates an X.509 certificate is revoked.
entries.name: CertificateRevokedException

entries.desc: An exception indicating one of a variety of problems encountered when validating a certification path.
entries.name: CertPathValidatorException

entries.desc: CRL (Certificate Revocation List) Exception.
entries.name: CRLException

desc: Provides classes and interfaces for parsing and managing certificates, certificate revocation lists (CRLs), and certification paths. It contains support for X.509 v3 certificates and X.509 v2 CRLs.  Package Specification  Java™   Cryptography Architecture (JCA) Reference Guide RFC 5280: Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Certificate and   Certificate Revocation List (CRL) Profile  RFC 2560: X.509 Internet Public Key Infrastructure Online Certificate   Status Protocol - OCSP   Java™   Cryptography Architecture Standard Algorithm Name   Documentation Related Documentation  For information about X.509 certificates and CRLs, please see:     http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc5280.txt Java™   PKI Programmer's Guide X.509 Certificates and Certificate Revocation Lists (CRLs)
